text: hey uzaki the name is synonymous with
beautiful fantastic worlds imaginative
design organically written characters as
well as stunning visuals and some of the
most impressive animation of all time
his work is universally praised and
respected by all all manner of film and
anime fans around the world the sheer
creative energy flowing from every frame
of Miyazaki film is immediately
noticeable by the youngest child to the
oldest adult it's very easy to be drawn
in the magical worlds and epic plot
lines that make up miyazaki's Universe I
think most people who are familiar with
the source material would agree that
there's a certain unique charm shared by
each of his works that while radically
different in setting theme and character
I'll maintain a consistent undeniable
almost spiritual
feel a master story teller knowing
exactly what strings to pull and when
his films never fail to elicit an
emotional response from the audience and
as a result his work has permeated
International culture so much that even
if you aren't aware of his name you've
likely been exposed to his movies at
some point so today we'll be looking at
miyazaki's films as I tribute this
Visionary director and talk about my
favorites keep in mind this list is
based purely on my opinion and we're
looking at featurelength films written
and directed by the man himself so short
films and other Studio jibli Productions
won't be making this list so with that
in mind I'll aboard the Cat Bus as we
ride into my top 10 Miyazaki
films honorable mention nazuka of the
Valley of the wind this prej film
follows the story of NASA a princess of
a small village in a post-apocalyptic
world full of giant insects and
poisonous spores as she struggles to
understand the nature of the toxic force
that surrounds them while facing
conflict from other humans this one
Teeters on the more serious side of
miyazaki's universe and serves as a
great example of his early work and the
beginnings of his signature
style number 10 leuda Castle in the Sky
a boy named patsu discovers a girl
falling from the sky the girl named
sheta is being pursued by the government
Army and Sky Pirates because she's in
possession of a magic Crystal that is
key to controlling an ancient floating
Castle the highlight of this entire film
is the Pirates Den mother DOA whose
journey goes from that of a ruthless
pirate leader and of develops into a
lovable and sympathetic character number
nine
poo oh whatever this is goldfish named
Pono is separated from her family and is
adopted by a young boy named Sasuke whom
she falls in love with when pono's
parents get involved the small mountain
town is devastated by a tsunami and the
pair set out to find s's missing mother
this is one of miyazaki's most abstract
Works pushing the bounds of creativity
in film through sheer imagination and
amazingly detailed animation
number eight Porco
Roso Marco is an ace pilot Bounty Hunter
and womanizer he's also an
anthropomorphic Pig retired after
fighting for the Italians in World War I
Porco makes a living by freelance bounty
hunting and escorting the film follows
the Rivalry between Porco and an
American pilot over bragging rights
honor and the hand of a beautiful woman
or two or maybe more we've established
he's a pig right Jokes Aside the film
stays true to its setting with Porco
feeling very much like a film Noir
character from in the 1920s or 30s there
are also some stunning air combat
sequences that make this A Feast for the
eyes as well number seven Kiki's
Delivery
Service as is tradition in her family a
young witch named Kiki leaves her home
for a year finding herself in the city
she makes a living by starting a
delivery service focusing on characters
over plot this is one of the most
heartwarming films I've ever seen the
relationships with people that Kiki
encounter feel very organic as are the
situation she faces this film tugs on
your heartstrings in all the right
places as Kiki goes through the
emotional highs and lows that come with
Coming of Age number six lupan theii the
castle of
cagliostro before we had Spike from
Cowboy bbop we had lupan theii
charismatic and aloof he is a master
Thief after knocking off a casino only
to discover to loot his counterfeit he
and his partner decide to Target the
source of the forgery which leads to an
epic Heist plot full of beautifully
animated action sequences and
wonderfully written characters made in
197 79 this is the first film on
miyazaki's filmography and it holds up
amazingly
well number five my neighbor tooro a
family move into a Countryside home and
soon learn the surrounding Woods are
haunted by a big lovable Dopey looking
magical creature named tooro the
daughters of the family befriend tooro
and some of the other local magical
Wildlife who watch over and protect the
family clearly on the more heartwarming
side of miyazaki's works I would also
suggest checking out the short 2010
sequel May and the Kitten Bus Number
Four The Wind Rises based Loosely on the
real life story of jro horic Koshi an
aeronautical engineer in Japan during
World War II we follow his life and
times as he strives to achieve his
dreams a slight departure from
miyazaki's normal style minimizing the
Fantastic elements but retaining his
signature focus on characters this film
feels more mature than any of his other
works number three how's Moving
Castle a young girl named Sophie has a
chance encounter with a powerful and
Charming wizard named Hal shortly
afterward she is cursed to old age by a
jealous witch and becomes entwined in
how's life as War breaks out between
local Nations the highlight of this film
for me is the Sophie character while she
has the appearance of an old lady she
still retains the mannerisms and vigor
of a youth and adjusts to her curse very
well she acts as a great analog for the
viewer slowly unraveling the mystery
surrounding how and befriending the
various characters that surround
him number two Spirited
Away a family with a young daughter
named Shiro get lost moving to their new
Home Instead ending up at what seems to
be an abandoned theme park after some
very poor decisions the family is
separated from their daughter who finds
herself not alone in the park but
surrounded by many ghostly apparitions
this is one of the most beautiful
animated films ever made as we follow
s's journey into the spirit world full
of unique and imaginative characters
where anything can happen number one
princess
monoke we follow a prince named ashitaka
who after defeating a demon that is
attacking his village is cursed and will
soon die he is then tased to travel West
and seek the source of the evil this was
my first Miyazaki film and still my
favorite even today miyazaki's Charming
characters beautiful animation and
magical Whimsy mixes very well with the
gritty and violent action drama genre
delivering a roller coaster of a and
amazement so those are my favorite films
by the Visionary aour writer director
and animator he Miyazaki a man who has
inspired and influenced countless people
around the world myself included at the
time of this video Miyazaki is 7 24
years old and is recently retired from
film making after the release of the
Wind Rises this has been the sixth time
he's retired so it's not out of the
realm of possibility to perhaps see
another Miyazaki film in the future but
I wouldn't hold my breath however his
son Goro Miyazaki seems set to continue
the name's Legacy with his first two
films Tales From Earth sea and from up
on Poppy Hill the era of traditional
animation has slowly been coming to an
end for years technology advances in the
old ways become obsolete handrawn
animation is being phased out in favor
of cheaper and quicker digital
techniques it's inevitable but I feel
these films serve as an example of how
beautiful traditional handdrawn
animation can be and that it's an art
form worth preserving for future
Generations those are my thoughts what
are yours leave a comment below once
again this was fade Dragon tier thanks
for watching peace out
